answers.answer: I don't even see how that possible unless he is planning on having you lose weight which is a big no no. By delivery between the water, baby, placenta, and so forth generally ways 15-20 lbs. I would just eat allot of fruits and veggies. For meat stick with a baked or serred in olive oil chicken. Things like watermelon are great for pregnant women because it's sweet, low calorie if any, and very high in iron. When it comes to starches stick with sweet potatoes, squash, and whole grain. If you like fish a servings of either tuna or salmon are a good choice to have once a week. All of it can be really tasty and healthy if cooked right. :)

Exercise and eating healthy. I walk every where which has kept my weight down. I had lost 34 pounds my first 15 weeks between severe morning sickness and sleep and walking and only gained 5 since and am now 31 weeks.  My doctor doesn't want me gaining much more weight. Weight gain recommendations are different for everyone.

It actually is very possible for on over weight person to only gain 10 pounds during pregnancy. Ask him what exercises he would recommend for you. I would suggest walking or swimming every day. Also, be aware of what you wawa reread eating. Cutting down on simple carbs like white rice, white bread and sugar are great ways to start. It will also help to cut down your risk of gestational diabetes,  which is higher when you are over weight.
